Class PlayerHandler

java.lang.Object
  PlayerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class PlayerHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

This will handle the players movements and collision detection Will be on a separate thread Has a keyboard listener class that will use input for player control Most of the logic will be here Created by Calvin on 4/12/2016.

Method Summary
 void movePlayerDown(int dy)
          Gets the coordinates of 3 points along the bottom of the players bounding box (bottom right, bottom middle, bottom left) Checks to see if any of those points would collide with a solid tile if the player were to move dy amount down
 void movePlayerLeft(int dx)
          Gets the coordinates of 3 points along the left side of the players bounding box (top left, middle left, bottom left) Checks to see if any of those points would collide with a solid tile if the player were to move dx amount to the left
 void movePlayerRight(int dx)
          Gets the coordinates of 3 points along the right side of the bounding box of the player (top right, middle right, bottom right) Checks to see if any of those points would collide with a solid tile if the player were to move dx to the right
 void movePlayerUp(int dy)
           
 void run()
          Handles all player stuff Includes handling actions such as moving and collisions
 void stop()
          Stops the run loop which ends the thread

Method Detail

movePlayerDown

public void movePlayerDown(int dy)
Gets the coordinates of 3 points along the bottom of the players bounding box (bottom right, bottom middle, bottom left) Checks to see if any of those points would collide with a solid tile if the player were to move dy amount down

Parameters:
dy - The amount to the move the player down

movePlayerLeft

public void movePlayerLeft(int dx)
Gets the coordinates of 3 points along the left side of the players bounding box (top left, middle left, bottom left) Checks to see if any of those points would collide with a solid tile if the player were to move dx amount to the left

Parameters:
dx - The amount to move the player to the right

movePlayerRight

Parameters:
dx - The amount to move player to the right
